# Trieste Port Rules Trieste Port is an MRP server, meaning that some level of roleplay is required.
[color=#ff0000]By joining the round, admins will assume you have read the rules regardless of your actions ingame.[/color]
ex:-'I didn't read the rules' is NOT a viable excuse.
## Core Rules These rules apply at all times, including between rounds.
- Admins have final say over a situation - Don't be a dick - No Hate Speech or Discriminatory Language >this includes specieism - No sexual content/themes, including erotic roleplay (ERP) and no shock content. You will be banned without hesitation. - Do not use out of game methods to communicate with other players in the same round. >this includes things such as being on a discord call - Do not attempt to evade bans - Only use English - Do not exploit the game, use cheats, or macros - Do not use multiple accounts, or alt accounts, and do not share accounts - Do not overly spam or ignore admin messages - Do not threaten to ahelp other players or argue with them about rules. Simply ahelp and move on. - Players must be and act at least 16 years old - Use realistic character names. Names of famous people or characters are not allowed.
## Roleplay Rules These rules only apply during a round. A round ends only when the game returns to the lobby. [color=#ff0000]All of these rules apply fully whenever the game is not at the lobby unless it is in an exempt game mode.[/color]
Roleplay rules do not apply to ghosts/spectators/observers while they are ghosts/spectators/observers. Dead chat is considered to be an in-game out of character chat channel.
- Silicons must follow their Silicon Laws - [textlink="Do not powergame" link="RuleM1"] - Familiars must obey their master - [textlink="Do not metagame, as in exploiting out-of character knowledge to gain an advantage" link="RuleM3"] - Don't act like an antagonist unless the game tells you that you are one - Do not stall the round - [textlink="As an antagonist, do not cause excessive death, damage, or destruction beyond your objectives. Try to avoid round removing pointlessly." link="RuleM6"] - Listen to your team leader - [textlink="Follow reasonable escalation" link="RuleM8"] - Do not needlessly abandon your role - Set an example if playing command or security - Command and Security will be held to a higher standard of roleplay - Command and Security must follow Space Law - Do not tamper with the Diving Bell or Wastewater ladder, or cause major flooding on purpose.
## Silicon Rules You are only silicon if the game clearly and explicitly tells you that you are a silicon. For players who are silicons, these Silicon Rules override all roleplay rules if there is any conflict. Silicon Rules do not override core rules.
- [textlink="1. Your silicon laws are rules" link="RuleS1"] - [textlink="2. Laws must be prioritized by their order" link="RuleS2"] - [textlink="3. Laws can redefine terms used in other laws" link="RuleS3"] - [textlink="4. You cannot request or allow a law change" link="RuleS4"] - [textlink="5. You are a free agent if you have no laws" link="RuleS5"] - [textlink="6. You are not required to follow orders which are extremely unreasonable" link="RuleS6"] - [textlink="7. You must remain consistent with your interpretation of laws" link="RuleS7"] - [textlink="8. Your HUD determines who is crew" link="RuleS8"] - [textlink="9. Harm refers to physical harm, prioritized by immediacy and likelihood" link="RuleS9"] - [textlink="10. You may determine how you resolve conflicts between orders" link="RuleS10"]
